title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
No Backlight.I Have Image. Confirmed.

F7700/L7701/D7701is 8.56V

Backlight Feedback XW7720 is 8.56V.

BKL_EN is 2.8V
BKL_PWM is 2.8V

PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is 8.5V

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
Did you check XW7720 continuity?
If OK, probably corroded balls under U7701.

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message: How do i check continuity. This is not actually a part on the board

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
Inspecting the bridge under microscope is usually good enough.
But you can check continuity between D7701 and corresponding U7701 ball; scratch a bit the trace near the corner of the chip.
If no good, then run the wire...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ujATnRVNYO93ifpZD7KPi6_swX4C38RH/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
Meter in Ohms Mode
Red to PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB
Black to PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT

I get 1.1 ohms

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
Looks good.
Possibly corrosion underneath U7701.

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message: Removed - Cleaned and Re installed U7701. Still the same.

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message: Have tried a known good display. its not a display issue

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
Did you check BKL_EN/PWM signals?
Also check all return resistors, R7717-22.

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
[QUOTE]
BKL_EN is 2.8V
BKL_PWM is 2.8V
[/QUOTE]

Voltages 
R7717 - R7720 is 2.3V
R7721-22 is 0.3V

Diode Mode Readings
 R7717-22 is .634

Continuity
R7717-R7722 is 1.2 Ohms

title: 820-00165 Backlight Issue
message:
"R7717 - R7720 is 2.3V
R7721-22 is 0.3V"
You should get almost same value on the six lines.
May have problems with the video connector; or traces from it to R7717-22.
